intro: Aegiphila capitata, commonly known as the clustered aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
